business.headline: The Great Indian Salary CrisisWhite-collar employees in India are caught in a salary spiral where costs keep climbing, pay moves slowly, and financial stability slips further away. On paper, the economy is booming, but the pay cheques of working middle-class Indians tell a very different story.
India proposes retaliatory duties at world trade body against US tariffs on autosIndia has proposed to impose an equivalent amount of duty collected from products originating in the United States.

Real Estate vs Mutual Funds: Where should you invest, explains stock market expertOwning a house was once every family's dream, but times have changed. With high prices and new ways to invest, is real estate still smart, or are mutual funds better? A stock market expert explains.

Ankur Mehra says creators must think like startups, not influencersAnkur Mehra, in his new book Pixels to Profits, urges creators to stop chasing follower counts and instead build sustainable, multi-platform businesses.

Success isn't about number of followers in creator economy: Ankur MehraIn a conversation with Business Today's Sakshi Batra, Ankur Mehra, author of Pixels to Profits, explains what it really takes to succeed in the creator economy, and why chasing viral fame or follower counts may be the wrong metric altogether.
Sensex ends 192 points higher, Nifty below 25,500; Infosys gains 1%Sensex ends 192 points higher, Nifty below 25,500; Infosys gains 1%

India tags it, West sells it. Can Prada's Kolhapuri row lead to real reform?The luxury brand's new "toe-ring sandal" has ignited not just cultural outrage but also legal action in India, with a Public Interest Litigation filed in the Bombay High Court.

Where are ITR-2 and ITR-3 forms? Why they're missing and what to doIt's ITR season but many taxpayers can't find the ITR-2 and ITR-3 forms on the Income Tax portal yet. If you have capital gains, foreign income or business income, this delay might worry you. The good news is there's an extended deadline this year. Here's why these forms are missing and what you should do next.

SBI credit card rules changing from July 15: Here's what cardholders must knowAt present, many cardholders pay only a small part of their bill to avoid late charges. But now, the way the minimum amount due (MAD) is calculated will change starting July 15, 2025.

One in 4 Indians still below minimum standard of living: World BankDespite a sharp drop in extreme poverty, about one in four Indians still falls below the level needed to meet essential needs and maintain a minimum standard of living.

Sebi bans Jane Street for stock market manipulation. Here's what went wrongUS Trading Firm Jane Street: Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) said the trades executed by the group were "prima facie fraudulent and manipulative" and violated the country's capital market regulations.

Want Rs 36 lakh in 5 years? Know who can avail this government schemeThis government scheme offers guaranteed returns, so you don't have to worry about market ups and downs. For the current quarter, the interest rate is fixed at 7.7% per year.

Why did Soham Parekh work multiple jobs? Indian techie shares his reasonsHe confirmed that he worked at several companies simultaneously and misrepresented his location and employment status in the process.

Gold gathering dust in locker? Financial advisor explains how to make it workA financial advisor has warned that family gold stored in lockers faces risk from rust, floods, and poor insurance. He explains how a scheme can offer safety and steady returns instead.

EPF, NPS can build Rs 12 crore retirement fund. Tax expert breaks it downFor salaried individuals earning up to Rs 14.65 lakh annually, Bangar believes this combination offers the best of both worlds: zero tax under the new regime and long-term wealth creation.
Sensex opens 82 points higher, Nifty below 25,500; Bajaj Finance up 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 46.97 points to 83,286.44, while the NSE Nifty50 added 14.45 points to 25,419.75 as of 9:22 am.

HCLTech joins hands with OpenAI to take AI to businessesThe collaboration aims to help global companies adopt AI at scale, combining HCLTech's industry experience with OpenAI's advanced AI models and tools.

Global trading firm Jane Street banned by Sebi from securities marketAccording to an order published on Sebi's website, the regulator has ordered the seizure of Rs 48.4 billion (approximately $570 million), which it claims is the total amount of illegal profit made by Jane Street.

DA hike July 2025: 4% increase likely for central government employeesDearness Allowance is revised twice a year, in January and July. It is based on the average of All India Consumer Price Index for Industrial Workers (AICPI-IW) data over the past 12 months.

Nvidia to become world's most valued company ever with $3.9 trillion market capNvidia is set to become the most valuable company ever, reaching a $3.92 trillion market cap amid soaring AI demand. Its dominance in AI chipmaking has fuelled rapid growth, outpacing rivals like Apple and Microsoft.

IndiGo appoints former NITI Aayog CEO Amitabh Kant as non-executive directorIndiGo has appointed former NITI Aayog CEO Amitabh Kant as a Non-Executive Director on its board, pending regulatory and shareholder approvals.

RBI bars foreclosure charges on floating rate loans to micro, small businessesAccording to the new rules, no prepayment charges will be allowed on floating rate loans to MSEs or to individuals borrowing for business purposes.

How poor is 'poor' in India?Millions of Indians have exited extreme poverty, yet many still live one crisis away from hunger, debt, or despair. In this deep dive, we examine why poverty is retreating in numbers, but not in reality.

Meesho files confidential papers for IPO to raise Rs 4,250 crore: ReportMeesho is a well-known player in India's booming e-commerce space, taking on giants like Amazon and Flipkart, with big global investors such as Prosus, Elevation Capital, WestBridge Capital, SoftBank, and Peak XV Partners backing it.
Sensex settles 170 points lower, Nifty below 25,500; Maruti down 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 170.22 points to end at 83,239.47, while the NSE Nifty50 fell by 48,10 points to close at 25,405.30.

Don't set and forget: Why your SIPs need regular check-upsWhile the idea of 'set it and forget it' may seem peaceful, doing so could lead to long-term underperformance, missed opportunities, or even a shortfall in your retirement goals.

Zerodha's Nithin Kamath cautions investors against risks in unlisted sharesNithin Kamath said that many people get carried away by the hype around buying shares of companies before they go public. But in reality, unlisted shares are risky and can leave investors stuck without a way to sell.

Has the oil market grown numb to conflict in the Middle East?Global oil demand growth in 2025 is on track to be just 870,000 barrels per day. This would make it the weakest year for oil demand since 2001, except during major economic disruptions like the 2008 financial crisis and the COVID-19 pandemic.

India's income inequality now worse than British era, says financial analystThe divide between India's rich and poor is bigger than ever, with almost half the people surviving on very little, while a privileged few hold most of the wealth, says Hardik Joshi, a financial analyst.

HDFC Bank CEO moves Supreme Court against Lilavati Hospital FIRThe clash between one of India's largest private banks and a big Mumbai hospital is linked to a financial transaction, but the exact details of the FIR or the amount involved were not shared in court.

Lost your ITR login? Here's how to file income tax using net bankingIf you can't remember your Income Tax portal password, you don't need to reset it straight away. Most major banks in India allow you to access the e-Filing portal through their net banking services. It's a safe and easy way to file your return on time.

Axis Bank, Nestle India set dividend record dates; last day to buy shares todayNestle India and Axis Bank have fixed July 4 as the record date, which will decide who is eligible to receive the dividend payouts.

The quiet Chinese game to disrupt iPhone production in IndiaThe latest model, the iPhone 17, was to be a huge step in Apple's plans to make India its second home for high-end production. That roadmap now looks uncertain as Foxconn has pulled out Chinese staff.

Who is Soham Parekh, Indian techie who worked at 4-5 US startups at same time?Soham Parekh, who is believed to be based in India, is alleged to have simultaneously worked at up to four or five startups—many of them backed by Y Combinator—raising questions about hiring practices in remote-first tech culture.
Sensex, Nifty struggle for direction as markets await India-US deal newsThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 13.01 points to 83,396.68, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 3.70 points to 25,449.70 as of 9:29 am.
Will Sensex, Nifty open higher amid US–Vietnam trade deal impact?Gift Nifty futures were trading at 25,584 points at 8:18 am, suggesting an increase from the previous close of 25,574.50.

Stocks to watch on July 3: Nykaa, RVNL, Nestle, Yes Bank, Dmart, PNBInvestors are now watching company announcements for the April–June quarter results, while developments related to a possible trade deal between India and the United States are also being closely followed.

Retiring without children? Here's how to plan for a comfortable and secure futureToday, more and more Indians are choosing to remain child-free or find themselves without direct heirs for various reasons. For them, retirement planning isn't just about saving money and building a corpus, it's about securing comfort, care, dignity, and independence in their golden years.

Sensex ends 288 points lower, Nifty settles below 25, 500; Tata Steel down 4%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 287.60 points to end at 83,409.69, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 88.40 points to end at 25,453.40.

Need your UAN? Here's how to get it and manage your PF smoothlyThe biggest advantage of a UAN is its permanence. It doesn't change when you change jobs. It ties together all your PF accounts, making fund tracking and management simple and paperless.

entertainment.headline: Shoaib Ibrahim says Dipika Kakar's cancer can recur, treatment may take 2 yearsActor Shoaib Ibrahim recently revealed that his wife Dipika Kakar's cancer can recur after surgery. He even updated fans about her medication and further treatment.

Metro In Dino box office Day 1: Anurag Basu's film is off to a decent startFilmmaker Anurag Basu's 'Metro In Dino' boasting a star-studded cast, hit theatres on July 4. The film, which opened to rave reviews, collected Rs 3.35 crore on its opening day.

Prabhas offers Rs 50 lakh aid for actor Fish Venkat's kidney transplantActor Prabhas has promised financial assistance to veteran comedian Fish Venkat, who is currently battling for his life in the ICU and urgently needs a kidney transplant.

Actor Julian McMahon dies at 56 after long battle with cancerJulian McMahon, known for Nip/Tuck, Charmed, and Fantastic Four, has died at 56 after battling cancer. The actor was celebrated for his versatility, charisma, and beloved roles in TV and film.

Arijit Singh becomes most followed on Spotify, beats Taylor Swift and Ed SheeranArijit Singh has become the most followed artist on Spotify with 151 million followers, surpassing global stars like Taylor Swift and Ed Sheeran. Despite having fewer monthly listeners, his follower count reflects a strong and dedicated global fan base.

Spirit: Sandeep Reddy Vanga to begin shooting in September, Prabhas to join laterFilming of 'Spirit' begins in September 2025, with Prabhas to join the set in November. The actor will star alongside Triptii Dimri in the upcoming film.

Munawar Faruqui on secret wedding with Mehzabeen Coatwala: It was for my sonMunawar Faruqui shared that his decision to marry Mehzabeen Coatwala was driven by his desire to live with his son, Mikael. The wedding, kept private, happened just a month after the decision and within five months of knowing Mehzabeen.

Metro In Dino X review: Fans impressed with Sara's performance, miss Irrfan'Metro In Dino', which released in theatres today (July 4) has got social media buzzing with reviews. As per X users, actor Sara Ali Khan has delivered an impressive performance.

Battle of Galwan reaction: Fans celebrate Salman Khan in uniform, welcome Bhaijaan's comebackFans celebrated Salman Khan's comeback on Friday as the Bollywood superstar shared the first motion poster of his upcoming film 'Battle Of Galwan.'

Battle of Galwan first look: Salman Khan is intense, fierce in uniformSalman Khan shared the motion poster of his upcoming film 'Battle of Galwan'. The story is based on one of India's most brutal battles fought without a single bullet being fired.

Girl's Day's Bang Minah, actor On Ju-wan set to get marriedK-pop band Girl's Day member Bang Minah and South Korean actor On Ju-wan's agencies have announced their plans to get married. The two worked together in a popular Kdrama.

Exclusive: Kriti Sanon to begin shooting for Cocktail 2 in AugustKriti Sanon has wrapped up shooting for 'Tere Ishk Mein' and is set to begin filming 'Cocktail 2' in August. After an intense schedule, the actor is currently taking a short break before diving into her next project.

Amal Clooney praises supportive husband George Clooney amid split rumoursAmal Clooney opened up about her family life with husband George Clooney, highlighting their strong bond and mutual support amid rumours of a rift. She shared that they continue to prioritise privacy for their children.

Who is Nikita Luther, winner of The Traitors alongside Uorfi Javed?Poker player Nikita Luther is now the winner of the reality TV show 'The Traitors'. She won the show alongside social media influencer Uorfi Javed.

ED questions Telugu film producer Allu Aravind for 3 hours in bank fraud caseTelugu film producer Allu Aravind was questioned by the ED for three hours in a Rs 101.4 crore bank fraud case involving Ramakrishna Electronics and RTPL. The ED seized properties, froze accounts, and uncovered evidence of fund diversion.

Jitendra Kumar to Neena Gupta, Panchayat stars rock vintage sportswear. PicsAfter winning everyone's hearts with its simple story and light-hearted humour, Panchayat Season 4 is ready to impress again! This time, new photos from a fun Pickleball-themed photoshoot are going viral on social media. The pictures feature Jitendra Kumar, Neena Gupta, Sanvikaa, Chandan Roy, Faisal Malik, Durgesh Kumar, and Ashok Pathak in a sporty and stylish tennis court setting. Dressed in vintage-style sports outfits with sweatbands, visors, and rackets, the cast looks both playful and fashionable.

Scarlett Johansson would've done Jurassic World even if she died in first 5 minutesScarlett Johansson has fulfilled her long-held wish to be part of the Jurassic franchise with a lead role in 'Jurassic World: Rebirth'. The BAFTA-winning actor explained how she got to play the lead in the latest film.

Boney Kapoor anxiously waiting for Anshula's return from New York after engagementInfluencer Anshula Kapoor, recently announced her engagement to partner Rohan Thakkar. Her father and film producer Boney Kapoor reacted to the news along with other family members.

Thammudu review: Wild ambitions but tamed execution in Nithiin's survival thrillerRelease Date:Fri Jul 04, 2025'Thammudu' movie review: Despite an intriguing premise and a visually rich setting, 'Thammudu' struggles with coherence, emotional depth, and narrative impact. What could have been a gripping one-night survival thriller turns into a long, meandering ride with fleeting moments of brilliance.

general news.headline: Live: Thackeray brothers reunite, reach mega joint rally in MumbaiMNS Shivsena Victory Rally Live Updates: Raj and Uddhav Thackeray - estranged for two decades - have reunited on Saturday to celebrate the Maharashtra government's rollback of Hindi as an optional third language. Their rare coming together, sparked by joint opposition to the proposed three-language formula that forced the Mahayuti government to pause the policy, has fuelled speculation about a potential political realignment. To celebrate "this triumph of Marathi unity," a rally will be held at 10 am at the NSCI Dome in Worli, drawing Marathi enthusiasts, writers, poets, educators, editors, and artists.

Rahul Gandhi's forecast on trade deal: Modi will bow to Trump tariff deadlineRahul Gandhi's reaction came as Union Minister Piyush Goyal asserted that India would enter into a trade agreement with the US only if its interests were protected.

Tycoon killed by biker 6 years after son's similar murder, CCTV captures incidentThe unidentified assailant opened fire on Gopal Khemka, owner of Magadh Hospital, just as he stepped out of his car near an apartment close to his residence near Panache Hotel, in the upscale Gandhi Maidan area.

What's the buzz about Neeraj Chopra Classic? A historic first for Indian sportThe Neeraj Chopra Classic marks a historic milestone as Bengaluru hosts its first-ever top-tier athletics meet, headlined and organised by Olympic champion Neeraj Chopra. With a star-studded field and global attention, the inaugural edition of NC Classic promises to be a spectacle. Here's what we know about the event, scheduled for July 5 in Bengaluru.

The Great Indian Salary CrisisWhite-collar employees in India are caught in a salary spiral where costs keep climbing, pay moves slowly, and financial stability slips further away. On paper, the economy is booming, but the pay cheques of working middle-class Indians tell a very different story.

Pahalgam attack unfortunate, India used it to destabilise peace, says Pak PMPakistani Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif, referring to Operation Sindoor, accused India of destabilising regional peace through 'unprovoked and reckless' hostility towards the country.

After ice bucket, now a governance challenge for netas, babus: Theek Karke Dikhao After the ice bucket challenge, used to raise funds for the neuro-degenerative disorder ALS, here's the viral Theek Karke Dikhao social media campaign in India. People are sharing images of roads with potholes, dug-up pavements and trash-filled urban water bodies on X and Facebook, and challenging politicians and bureaucrats to fix them.

Pakistan doesn't know where Masood Azhar is, may be in...: Bilawal BhuttoBilawal Bhutto, in an interview with Al Jazeera, said that Masood Azhar may be in Afghanistan, and denied that Hafiz Saeed is free. He also said that Pakistan is willing to act if India shares evidence.

Vijay as Tamil Nadu CM aspirant may find 'vijay' in 2026 elusiveAnnouncing himself as the chief ministerial candidate allows Vijay to directly leverage his remarkable star power and the loyalty of his fans into political capital. He is directly challenging the established political order and that creates a compelling narrative for his supporters.

World Champion D Gukesh wins rapid title at Grand Chess Tour 2025 ZagrebReigning World Champion D. Gukesh won the rapid title at the Grand Chess Tour 2025 Rapid & Blitz in Zagreb, Croatia, on Friday. The 19-year-old scored 14 points out of a possible 18, recovering from an early setback to finish at the top of the standings.

Jairam Ramesh takes premium flyer dig at PM, recalls Argentina's Indira linkCongress's Jairam Ramesh jabbed PM Narendra Modi after the latter arrived in Argentina by terming him a "super-premium frequent flyer" and also recalling the Latin American nation's 1986 honour for Indira Gandhi.

No food, moved around like cattle: Newlywed bride recounts US immigration custodyA newlywed Palestinian woman from Texas says she was "treated like cattle" during 140 days in the ICE detention after her honeymoon, calling the experience dehumanising and unlawful.
How a silver revolution is taking place in Indian gymsA new set of fitness enthusiasts is finally hitting Indian gyms: people in their 50s and 60s.

Trump signs 'One Big Beautiful Bill' into law at White House July 4 celebrationsUS President Donald Trump signed the "One Big Beautiful Bill" into law, a sweeping tax and spending package passed on July 4, sparking controversy over healthcare cuts and its USD 3 trillion debt impact.

England edge India in final-ball thriller to keep T20I series aliveEngland Women held their nerve in a last-ball thriller to edge out India by five runs, pulling one back in the T20I series after a dramatic collapse and a disciplined bowling comeback at The Oval.

Man gets trapped inside lift during fire at Delhi shopping complex, diesThe blaze reportedly started on the first floor of the building at 6:44 pm due to a short circuit. Initial attempts were made to douse the fire using in-house fire extinguishers, but the flames quickly spread throughout the store.

Russian woman lists 8 'cringe' Indian habits she now finds normal in viral videoA Russian woman living in Bengaluru shared eight Indian habits she happily follows, from eating with hands to embracing love-filled conversations, in a now-viral Instagram video.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Twist in Pune rape case: Top cop says woman knew accused, wrote threatening textIn a twist in the Pune rape case, a woman, who was allegedly raped by a man posing as a delivery boy, claimed she knew the accused and wrote the threatening text herself on her phone, city police commissioner Amitesh Kumar said.

Super Mohammed Siraj steps up and becomes India's pace leader in Bumrah's absenceMohammed Siraj stepped up in the absence of Jasprit Bumrah to deliver a stunning performance during the first innings of the Edgbaston Test against England. Coming into the game as a man with a plan and a point to prove, Siraj just stuck to his basics to rattle the English batting lineup.

Metro In Dino box office Day 1: Anurag Basu's film is off to a decent startFilmmaker Anurag Basu's 'Metro In Dino' boasting a star-studded cast, hit theatres on July 4. The film, which opened to rave reviews, collected Rs 3.35 crore on its opening day.

Socialist Mamdani faces backlash over mother Mira Nair's $2-million houseZohran Mamdani, New York City's socialist mayoral candidate, may face public scrutiny over his family's wealth. The socialist candidate's mother, Mira Nair, owns a $2-million house in the city. Critics say Mamdani, who owns a four-acre plot in Uganda, is too privileged to be speaking of socialism.

8 including groom killed in UP's Sambhal as car crashes into college wallAccording to police, there were more than 12 people in the ill-fated car that lost control. The groom, three children and four others perished in the accident.

After the 90-degree flyover, now 'snake-like' bridge under scrutiny in BhopalTwo accidents within just eight hours on the Subhash Nagar Railway Over Bridge (ROB) have raised serious concerns about its design and safety, with experts and citizens questioning whether the structure is an accident waiting to happen.

sports.headline: 2nd Test: Jayden Seals balances scales after Australia dominate Day 2Jayden Seales dismantled Australia's top order early in the second innings of the Grenada Test. His bowling gave West Indies a crucial chance of surviving in this Test match.

Coming into the game as a man with a plan and a point to prove, Siraj just stuck to his basics to rattle the English batting lineup.

Sabalenka avoids high-profile exodus, douses Raducanu's fire in Round 3Top seed Aryna Sabalenka survived a fierce battle against Emma Raducanu to enter Round 4 at Wimbledon 2025. The match showcased intense competition and left the crowd electrified with drama and remarkable tennis.

A historic first for Indian sportThe Neeraj Chopra Classic marks a historic milestone as Bengaluru hosts its first-ever top-tier athletics meet, headlined and organised by Olympic champion Neeraj Chopra. With a star-studded field and global attention, the inaugural edition of NC Classic promises to be a spectacle. Here's what we know about the event, scheduled for July 5 in Bengaluru.

Neves, Cancelo fight off tears while observing silence for Diogo JotaAl Hilal players paid emotional tribute to Diogo Jota before their Club World Cup quarterfinal. Joao Cancelo and Ruben Neves were seen fighting off tears ahead of the game.

You might not know the talent in you: Akash Deep on Gautam Gambhir's hype messageAkash Deep revealed the motivational message he got from India coach Gautam Gambhir after his stunning performance in the Edgbaston Test. Akash, along with Mohammed Siraj, helped India secure a big lead.

Gukesh gives hilarious shoutout to cousin after win over CarlsenIndian grandmaster D Gukesh clinched the rapid title at the Grand Chess Tour Zagreb by defeating Magnus Carlsen. In a hilarious interview, Gukesh revealed that one of his cousins was very upset with him.

Mohammed Siraj relishing responsibility of leading pace attack in Bumrah's absenceIndia fast bowler Mohammed Siraj revealed that he's relishing the challenge of leading India's pace attack in the absence of Jasprit Bumrah in the second Test against England at Edgbaston, Birmingham.

England confident of triggering India collapse to stage comeback: BrookEngland batter Harry Brook has revealed that they're banking on India's collapse on Day 4 to make a comeback into the second Test at Edgbaston, Birmingham.

Wimbledon: Alcaraz reaches Round 4 with hard-fought win, Norrie, Mertens advanceCarlos Alcaraz overcame Jan-Lennard Struff in four sets to make it to the fourth round of Wimbledon on Friday, July 4. Cam Norrie and Elise Mertens also booked their places in the fourth round with straight set wins.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
